sen.j: 忍坂大中姫（おしさかのおおなかつのひめ）は第19代允恭天皇の后であり、第21代雄略天皇の母。
sen.e: Oshisakano onakatsunohimeno Mikoto was the Empress of the nineteenth Emperor Ingyo and the mother of the twenty-first Emperor Yuryaku.
Oshisakano onakatsunohimeno Mikoto was the Empress of the nineteenth Emperor Ingyo and the mother of the twenty-first Emperor Yuryaku.
Oshisakano onakatsunohimeno Mikoto was the Empress of the nineteenth Emperor Ingyo and the mother of the twenty-first Emperor Yuryaku.
Her father was Wakanoke futamata no Miko.
Her father was Wakanoke futamata no Miko.
Her father was Wakanoke futamata no Miko.

sen.j: 日本書紀允恭紀に、允恭2年春2月14日立后されたとある。
sen.e: In the Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), noted in the section of written records on the Ingyou Emperor Period, there was this statement: In the Spring of, February 14th, '413', the Emperor Ingyo had married the Empress.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In the Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), noted in the section of written records on the Ingyou Emperor Period, there was this statement: in the spring of, February 14, 413, the Emperor Ingyo had married the Empress.
sen.cmt: 日付表記の統一と、大文字→小文字への修正を行いました。
sen.e: In the Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), noted in the section of written records on the Ingyou Emperor Period, there was this statement: in the spring of, February 14, 413, the Emperor Ingyo had married the Empress.

sen.j: そして、名代部として刑部（おっさかべ）が設定されたとある。
sen.e: As a Nashirobe (a representative who served for Imperial family or the royal family, and administrated over the local regions, in ancient Japan; and the divided regions there, were ruled by the Imperial family or royal family.) for the Empress, this Osakabe (Osakabe clans) was established.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: As a Nashirobe (a representative who served for Imperial family or the royal family, and administrated over the local regions, in ancient Japan; and the divided regions there, were ruled by the Imperial family or royal family.) for the Empress, this Ossakabe (Ossakabe clans) was established.
sen.cmt: 原文にあわせて、ローマ字表記を「おっさかべ」に変更しました。
sen.e: As a Nashirobe (a representative who served for Imperial family or the royal family, and administrated over the local regions, in ancient Japan; and the divided regions there, were ruled by the Imperial family or royal family.) for the Empress, this Ossakabe (Ossakabe clans) was established.

sen.j: このとき設定された名代部の一つが火葦北国（ひのあしきたのくに。熊本県八代・葦北地方）であるとする説がある。
sen.e: It was at this same time, "Hinoashikita no Kuni (Yatsushiro and Ashikita County, Kumamoto Prefecture)", being one of those same Nashirobe, was established.
It was said that at this same time, Hinoashikita no Kuni (Yatsushiro and Ashikita County, Kumamoto Prefecture), being one of those same Nashirobe, was established.
sen.cmt: 「説がある」の部分に訳漏れがあります。用語レベルのため追記しました。” ”が全角、かつ不要なため削除しました。
sen.e: It was said that at this same time, Hinoashikita no Kuni (Yatsushiro and Ashikita County, Kumamoto Prefecture), being one of those same Nashirobe, was established.

sen.j: 当地から阿蘇ピンク石という石材が産出している。
sen.e: The stones produced for building, taken from this area, were particularly unique in their quality; these "Aso Pink stones (a kind of Ignimbrite or welded tuff formed from the Aso regional volcanic activity.)."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The stones produced for building, taken from this area, were particularly unique in their quality; these "Aso Pink stones (a kind of Ignimbrite or welded tuff formed from the Aso regional volcanic activity.)."

The stones produced for building called "Aso Pink stones" (a kind of Ignimbrite or welded tuff formed from the Aso regional volcanic activity.), taken from this area, were particularly unique in their quality.
sen.cmt: buildingの後にcalledを挿入して“Aso Pink stones”を続けました。

sen.j: 河内平野の古墳の石棺にこの石材が用いられていることから、何らかの関係があるとする見方もある。
sen.e: Since the Aso Pink stones was used to build the stone coffins inside the Kawachiheiya Kofun, some scholars and historians, take the point of view, that this place and 'Hinoashikita no Kuni' must be related.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Since the Aso Pink stones were used to build the stone coffins inside the kofun (tumulus) in Kawachi Plain, some scholars and historians take the point of view that this place and Hinoashikita no Kuni must be related.
sen.cmt: was=>wereへ（複数形）修正しました。「河内平野の古墳」の表現を登録の用語にあわせて変更しました。take the point of view前後のカンマを削除しました。’ ’は全角、かつ不要なため削除しました。
sen.e: Since the Aso Pink stones were used to build the stone coffins inside the kofun (tumulus) in Kawachi Plain, some scholars and historians take the point of view that this place and Hinoashikita no Kuni must be related.
